summary: The source primarily features a high-profile keynote lecture by former Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm on the future of clean energy. This is a significant event related to Climate Week and directly aligns with core career interests in sustainability and energy policy. No other events were found in the specified date range.

events.title: Powering Tomorrow: A Conversation on the Clean Energy Future
events.description: As part of Climate Week, the School for Environment and Sustainability (SEAS) hosts former U.S. Secretary of Energy Jennifer Granholm for a keynote address. The conversation will explore the future of clean energy, policy, and innovation.
events.location: Rackham Auditorium, 915 E Washington St, Ann Arbor, MI
events.must_see_rationale: Features keynote by Jennifer Granholm, a major figure in energy policy.
events.career_rationale: Directly addresses core career interests in energy policy and sustainability with a high-profile speaker.
events.social_rationale: While primarily a lecture, a Q&A session offers some interactive social engagement.
events.wellbeing_rationale: This event has no direct wellbeing or fitness component.
